intro: Retinispora taiwanensis, commonly known as the Taiwan retinispora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myristicaceae. It is native to Taiwan and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a glossy surface, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. Retinispora taiwanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
